job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: ltpgtWere a team of passionate data scientists software engineers and subject matter experts with a vision to disrupt the simulation market by empowering users to build custom digital twin models that combine physics math and AI to solve various challenging problems in the energy industry and beyondltpgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtWere looking for entrylevel or seasoned frontend developers to help us build innovative features for our webbased dashboard The following summarizes the requirements and benefits of this roleampnbspltpgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtResponsibilitiesltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtBuilding intuitive experiences for users and data managementltligtltligtImplementing simple yet powerful visualization tools for scientific and engineering applicationsltligtltligtCreating interactive user experiences involving humanhuman and humanAI collaborationsltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtCore SkillsltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtSelfdriven curious and passionate software developerltligtltligtStrong problemsolving skills or good engineering  scientific judgmentltligtltligtTeam player comfortable working in an Agile environmentltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtCoding SkillsltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtPractical experience building eventdriven and dynamic web applicationsltligtltligtExperience working with React or similar JS frameworks is preferred but not requiredltligtltligtComfortable with objectoriented programming writing tested code and good software designltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtBackgroundltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtA Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related fields is preferred but not requiredltligtltligtPermission to work in the USltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtPerksltstronggtltpgtltulgtltligtCompetitive compensation and benefitsltligtltligt3 weeks of paid vacation per yearltligtltligtFlexible remote work cultureltligtltulgt
